verses.verse: But there were false <S%G5578><s%> prophets <S%G5578><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> the people, <S%G2992><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> as there shall be false <S%G5572><s%> teachers <S%G5572><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> you, who <S%G3748><s%> privately <S%G3919><s%> shall bring <S%G3919><s%> in damnable <S%G684><s%> heresies, <S%G139><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> denying <S%G720><s%> the Lord <S%G1203><s%> that bought <S%G59><s%> them, and bring <S%G1863><s%> on themselves <S%G1438><s%> swift <S%G5031><s%> destruction. <S%G684><s%>

And many <S%G4183><s%> shall follow <S%G1811><s%> their pernicious <S%G684><s%> ways; <S%G684><s%> by reason <S%G1223><s%> of whom <S%G3739><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> of truth <S%G225><s%> shall be evil <S%G987><s%> spoken <S%G987><s%> of.

And through <S%G1722><s%> covetousness <S%G4124><s%> shall they with feigned <S%G4112><s%> words <S%G3056><s%> make <S%G1710><s%> merchandise of you: whose <S%G3739><s%> judgment <S%G2917><s%> now of a long time <S%G1597><s%> lingers <S%G691><s%> not, and their damnation <S%G684><s%> slumbers <S%G3573><s%> not.

For if <S%G1487><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> spared <S%G5339><s%> not the angels <S%G32><s%> that sinned, <S%G264><s%> but cast <S%G5020><s%> them down to hell, <S%G5020><s%> and delivered <S%G3860><s%> them into chains <S%G4577><s%> of darkness, <S%G2217><s%> to be reserved <S%G5083><s%> to judgment; <S%G2920><s%>

And spared <S%G5339><s%> not the old <S%G744><s%> world, <S%G2889><s%> but saved <S%G5442><s%> Noah <S%G3575><s%> the eighth <S%G3590><s%> person, a preacher <S%G2783><s%> of righteousness, <S%G1343><s%> bringing <S%G1863><s%> in the flood <S%G2627><s%> on the world <S%G2889><s%> of the ungodly; <S%G765><s%>

And turning <S%G5077><s%> the cities <S%G4172><s%> of Sodom <S%G4670><s%> and Gomorrha <S%G1116><s%> into ashes <S%G5077><s%> condemned <S%G2632><s%> them with an overthrow, <S%G2692><s%> making <S%G4160><s%> them an ensample <S%G5262><s%> to those <S%G3588><s%> that after <S%G3195><s%> should <S%G3195><s%> live ungodly; <S%G764><s%>
And delivered <S%G4506><s%> just <S%G1342><s%> Lot, <S%G3091><s%> vexed <S%G2669><s%> with the filthy <S%G766><s%> conversation <S%G391><s%> of the wicked: <S%G113><s%>

(For that righteous <S%G1342><s%> man dwelling <S%G1460><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them, in seeing <S%G990><s%> and hearing, <S%G189><s%> vexed <S%G928><s%> his righteous <S%G1342><s%> soul <S%G5590><s%> from day <S%G2250><s%> to day <S%G2250><s%> with their unlawful <S%G459><s%> deeds; <S%G2041><s%>)

The Lord <S%G2962><s%> knows <S%G1492><s%> how to deliver <S%G4506><s%> the godly <S%G2152><s%> out of temptations, <S%G3986><s%> and to reserve <S%G5083><s%> the unjust <S%G94><s%> to the day <S%G2250><s%> of judgment <S%G2920><s%> to be punished: <S%G2849><s%>

But chiefly <S%G3122><s%> them that walk <S%G4198><s%> after <S%G3694><s%> the flesh <S%G4561><s%> in the lust <S%G1939><s%> of uncleanness, <S%G3394><s%> and despise <S%G2706><s%> government. <S%G2963><s%> Presumptuous <S%G5113><s%> are they, self-willed, <S%G829><s%> they are not afraid <S%G5141><s%> to speak <S%G987><s%> evil <S%G987><s%> of dignities. <S%G1391><s%>

Whereas <S%G3699><s%> angels, <S%G32><s%> which are greater <S%G3187><s%> in power <S%G2479><s%> and might, <S%G1411><s%> bring <S%G5342><s%> not railing <S%G989><s%> accusation <S%G2920><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> them before <S%G3844><s%> the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

But these, <S%G3778><s%> as natural <S%G5446><s%> brute <S%G249><s%> beasts, <S%G2226><s%> made <S%G1080><s%> to be taken <S%G259><s%> and destroyed, <S%G5356><s%> speak <S%G987><s%> evil <S%G987><s%> of the things that they understand <S%G50><s%> not; and shall utterly <S%G2704><s%> perish <S%G2704><s%> in their own <S%G848><s%> corruption; <S%G5356><s%>

And shall receive <S%G2865><s%> the reward <S%G3408><s%> of unrighteousness, <S%G93><s%> as they that count <S%G2233><s%> it pleasure <S%G2237><s%> to riot <S%G5172><s%> in the day <S%G2250><s%> time. Spots <S%G4696><s%> they are and blemishes, <S%G3470><s%> sporting <S%G1792><s%> themselves with their own <S%G848><s%> deceivings <S%G539><s%> while they feast <S%G4910><s%> with you;

Having <S%G2192><s%> eyes <S%G3788><s%> full <S%G3324><s%> of adultery, <S%G3428><s%> and that cannot <S%G180><s%> cease <S%G180><s%> from sin; <S%G266><s%> beguiling <S%G1185><s%> unstable <S%G793><s%> souls: <S%G5590><s%> an heart <S%G2588><s%> they have <S%G2192><s%> exercised <S%G1128><s%> with covetous <S%G4124><s%> practices; cursed <S%G2671><s%> children: <S%G5043><s%>

Which have <S%G2192><s%> forsaken <S%G2641><s%> the right <S%G2117><s%> way, <S%G3598><s%> and are gone <S%G4105><s%> astray, <S%G4105><s%> following <S%G1811><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> of Balaam <S%G903><s%> the son of Bosor, <S%G1007><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> loved <S%G25><s%> the wages <S%G3408><s%> of unrighteousness; <S%G93><s%>

But was rebuked <S%G2192><s%> <S%G1649><s%> for his iniquity: <S%G3892><s%> the dumb <S%G880><s%> ass <S%G5268><s%> speaking <S%G5350><s%> with man's <S%G444><s%> voice <S%G5456><s%> forbade <S%G2967><s%> the madness <S%G3913><s%> of the prophet. <S%G4396><s%>

These <S%G3778><s%> are wells <S%G4077><s%> without <S%G504><s%> water, <S%G504><s%> clouds <S%G3507><s%> that are carried <S%G4064><s%> with a tempest; <S%G2978><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> the mist <S%G2217><s%> of darkness <S%G4655><s%> is reserved <S%G5083><s%> for ever. <S%G165><s%>

For when they speak <S%G5350><s%> great <S%G5246><s%> swelling <S%G5246><s%> words of vanity, <S%G3153><s%> they allure <S%G1185><s%> through <S%G1722><s%> the lusts <S%G1939><s%> of the flesh, <S%G4561><s%> through much wantonness, <S%G766><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> that were clean <S%G3689><s%> escaped <S%G668><s%> from them who live <S%G390><s%> in error. <S%G4106><s%>

While they promise <S%G1861><s%> them liberty, <S%G1657><s%> they themselves <S%G846><s%> are the servants <S%G1401><s%> of corruption: <S%G5356><s%> for of whom <S%G3739><s%> a man <S%G5100><s%> is overcome, <S%G2274><s%> of the same <S%G3778><s%> is he brought <S%G1402><s%> in bondage. <S%G1402><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> after they have escaped <S%G668><s%> the pollutions <S%G3393><s%> of the world <S%G2889><s%> through <S%G1722><s%> the knowledge <S%G1922><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> and Savior <S%G4990><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ, <S%G5547><s%> they are again <S%G3825><s%> entangled <S%G1707><s%> therein, <S%G5125><s%> and overcome, <S%G2274><s%> the latter <S%G2078><s%> end <S%G2078><s%> is worse <S%G5501><s%> with them than the beginning. <S%G4413><s%>

For it had been <S%G2258><s%> better <S%G2909><s%> for them not to have known <S%G1921><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> of righteousness, <S%G1343><s%> than, <S%G2228><s%> after they have known <S%G1921><s%> it, to turn <S%G1994><s%> from the holy <S%G40><s%> commandment <S%G1785><s%> delivered <S%G3860><s%> to them.

But it is happened <S%G4819><s%> to them according to the true <S%G227><s%> proverb, <S%G3942><s%> The dog <S%G2965><s%> is turned <S%G1994><s%> to his own <S%G2398><s%> vomit <S%G1829><s%> again; <S%G1994><s%> and the sow <S%G5300><s%> that was washed <S%G3068><s%> to her wallowing <S%G2946><s%> in the mire. <S%G1004><s%>
